title: What are some worthy goals to pursue in life? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. Changing Government Systems I want to make the world a better place. There are certain areas in our society that need radical improvements, such as the government systems. For example, isn’t there a better system than democracy? Now we are hundreds of times more people than during the Roman times, we also have the greatest intellect, and we can’t think of better ideas for better government systems? I find that really strange. Don’t get me wrong, I’m not saying that democracy is a bad thing, but the fact that it is based on ideas so old is a bit troubling. I mean we live in the 21th century and we cannot find better solutions than democracy? Can’t we find better ways to fight corruption? You can double check everything and make it corruption-free, you can establish an internet-based system where people go and vote on a daily basis and so on. That is a worthy goal in my opinion: how can we develop better government systems, without corruption and with more educated people and more educated decisions from both sides?   1. Changing The Educational Systems I also want to change the educational system. I think we shouldn’t expect brilliant people like Einstein to arise randomly. We should do something in order to help that happen. Personally, I find what I’m doing at the moment extremely successful at developing my intelligence. That is why I want to have an educational system were children can learn how to become confident and more aware about the type of person they want to be. People are not aware of that yet, that they can choose a different direction in life. I’ve talked to a girl today in a product manufacturing company and she firmly believed that she couldn’t achieve what she really wanted. Because she had not been told that she could become the C.E.O. of the company, she didn’t think that there were possibilities to change her life, without having to work so hard for making a living. It is like we have these Internet firewalls that keep us captive in a fixed mindset, which doesn’t allow us to evolve properly out of the fear of the unknown. “My father was a doctor, therefore I’m going to be a doctor too, not because I like it, but because it runs in the family.” Something like that.    3. Bulding a Community I want to build a community around me of the most interesting people. The idea of people with common interests and principles can lead only to progress. We should all become a community, not a simple society. A community implies more cohesion and a stronger mutual acceptance. Speaking of that,   4. Uniting The Humankind sounds good. Another worthy goal would be to combine all the nations into one country. Deny the human race for a greater humankind. We are called humankind, but we aren’t really kind in that way, and I find that disturbing, because we fight between each other and we have wars. Perhaps we could avoid that if the world was one country run by the people, democracy wise. If we solve one issue after another, I think all these are achievable.  Changing governments and education, uniting the world. How can we do that?
